conclusion: Predict which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after being released from points A, B, and C and passing through the baffles.

The image shows a vertical board with three release points at the top labeled A (cyan), B (orange), and C (pink). There are several baffles on the board, and two containers at the bottom labeled D (left, orange) and E (right, brown).
The baffles are positioned at various angles, which will redirect the liquid’s path.
An orange baffle (below A) angled downward to the right.
A white baffle (below the orange one) angled downward to the left.
A purple baffle (below the white one) angled downward to the left.
A cyan baffle (below B and C) angled downward to the left.
A yellow baffle (to the right of the cyan one) angled downward to the left.
Container D is on the left side, directly below the purple baffle.
Container E is on the right side, below the yellow baffle.
The liquid will flow straight down unless redirected by a baffle. When it hits a baffle, it will slide along the baffle’s slope and continue downward from the baffle’s end.
Liquid from Point A (Cyan) starts at the top left.
Liquid from A falls straight down and hits the orange baffle directly below A, which slopes downward to the right.
Liquid slides along the orange baffle and falls off its right end.
From the right end of the orange baffle, the liquid falls straight down and hits the white baffle, which slopes downward to the left.
Liquid slides along the white baffle and falls off its left end.
From the left end of the white baffle, the liquid falls straight down and hits the purple baffle, which also slopes downward to the left.
Liquid slides along the purple baffle and falls off its left end.
From the left end of the purple baffle, the liquid falls straight down into container D.
Liquid from Point B (Orange) starts in the middle at the top.
Liquid from B falls straight down and hits the cyan baffle directly below B, which slopes downward to the left.
